semantic_title: Separate Codes for Each Burn Site - Individual Site Coding Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Injury, Poisoning, and Certain Other Consequences of External Causes > d. Coding of Burns and Corrosions > 5) Assign separate codes for each burn site

content.full_text: When coding burns, assign separate codes for each burn site. Category T30, Burn and corrosion, body region unspecified is extremely vague and should rarely be used. Codes for burns of 'multiple sites' should only be assigned when the medical record documentation does not specify the individual sites. (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86-L87)
content.summary: Requirement for individual site-specific coding for burns, with restrictions on use of unspecified and multiple site codes (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86-L87)
key_concepts: Separate codes for each burn site (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86)
Avoidance of T30 category (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86-L87)
Restricted use of multiple site codes (Evidence: pg no: 81, L87)

detailed_rules.rule_text: When coding burns, assign separate codes for each burn site (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86)
detailed_rules.explanation: Each anatomically distinct burn site requires its own specific code (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Category T30, Burn and corrosion, body region unspecified is extremely vague and should rarely be used (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86-L87)
detailed_rules.explanation: T30 codes lack specificity and should be avoided when specific site information is available (Evidence: pg no: 81, L86-L87)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Codes for burns of 'multiple sites' should only be assigned when the medical record documentation does not specify the individual sites (Evidence: pg no: 81, L87)
detailed_rules.explanation: Multiple site codes are only appropriate when individual sites cannot be determined from documentation (Evidence: pg no: 81, L87)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review documentation for all burn sites
Step 2: Identify each specific anatomical location
Step 3: Assign separate code for each identified site
Step 4: Avoid T30 and multiple site codes when sites are specified
Step 5: Use multiple site codes only when individual sites unknown
